alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 10 at 2:39AM MDT until October 12 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, locally up to 12 inches in the high Uintas and 15 inches in the upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From 9 AM Wednesday to noon MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are possible, especially across high elevation seasonal routes such as Monte Cristo and the Mirror Lake Highway. Lake effect snow may also bring periods of winter driving conditions to the Cottonwood Canyons Wednesday night into Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hikers, hunters, campers and other recreationalists in the backcountry should be prepared for winter conditions with accumulating snow across the northern mountains Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
